title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Roswell Waldo to Orlando Brown, October 31, 1868
summary: In his report, Waldo remarks that although he knows of no cases of actual discrimination in the legal system, he observes a "spirit" of injustice towards blacks and whites loyal to the Union government among Magistrates. Waldo also reports that he continue to settle civil matters outside of the courts.
keywords: Legal System, Violence/Crime, Race Relations, Patriotism, Employment/Labor, American Civil War
